info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 09 at 3:24PM EST until January 09 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EST FOR EASTERN UNION COUNTY... At 324 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Albemarle to 16 miles northwest of Wadesboro to 12 miles southeast of Monroe, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Wingate, Marshville, Sturdivants, Trinity, and New Salem. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for the Piedmont of North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
